children.subject:
He sent me a rough description:


In Music 159, we will explore topics in computer-assisted music composition using Ircam’s OpenMusic (OM) graphical programming environment.  We will work to develop personalized techniques for formalizing and developing musical ideas and investigate generative and algorithmic compositional techniques.  In conjunction with this work, we will also explore several areas in depth, including: analysis/resynthesis, various synthesis techniques (including additive, frequency modulation, granular and others), and 3d  spatial audio. To this end, we will utilize CNMAT externals and sound generators as well as a set of libraries designed for OM that are used to control external sound analysis, processing and synthesis tools, such as Csound, SuperVP, pm2, and Spat.

Music 159 will take place in the computer lab and students will develop short pieces in-class on a weekly basis, as well as more substantial works as midterm and final projects. The course will be of interest to any composer of acoustic music or computer music seeking ways to investigate and develop new compositional materials. (OM’s musical editors make this environment particularly useful for this work.) The course will also be of equal value to the computer musician seeking to expand synthesis and spatial audio techniques for musical productions. As a visual programming language built on CommonLisp, OM also offers computer programmers a large potential for powerful control and elaboration of musical ideas.  Prior programming experience is not required but students who have not previously taken Music 158 will need permission from the instructor to enroll.

Point your browser here for more information on OpenMusic: http://repmus.ircam.fr/openmusic/home.

(I assume enrollment isn't ready yet)
Does Music 159 count as one of the upper-div classes needed for the CS minor? If I haven't taken 158, will that be a serious impediment towards me doing well in 159?
I emailed matthew about the course today, will post anything I learn

history.content: When I was trying to register MUSIC 159, the system kept asking me to choose a lab section, but there is no lab section for this course. I cannot click "next" as well. Is this a bug? What shall I do?
history.subject: Can't enroll MUSIC 159
